intro: Lupinus densiflorus var. perfistulosus, commonly known as the dense-flowered lupine, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to purple. The leaves are compound, consisting of several oval-shaped leaflets arranged in pairs. This variety is adapted to grow in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in grasslands and open woodlands. Its botanical features make it an important species for both ecological and horticultural purposes.
